positions.comment: Raining for days, now clearing, ETA Berm late 3 July
Expect see Bermuda in 3 hrs, in marina before dusk
Reached Bermuda  late 3 July, staying 1 week +/-
Leaving Bermuda 12 July for Azores, Walt, Willie, Miss Irene
Left Bermuda 12 July for Azores, motoring no wind
Major battery failure, will go to Boston to replace, then go to Azores
Big alternator failed, taking pwr fm starting battery alternator
Dep Salem 3pm EDT 26th, new batteries, going fast under sail only, Gareth ok,
Very foggy last night, 20 m visibility, clear now, approaching Gulf Stream
100 mi to Gulf Stream, v light tail wind after Franklin went past
Motored to the loc of G Stream, but no favorable current yet, don't know why
"CARIAD" 4POB dest. Azores via n5jng@mmsn.org
No wind, small bird between Gareth's feet while steering in the dark, scared him
Making max spd east to outrun weakening remnants of trop storm Harvey
Making max spd E to outrun weakening remnants of trop storm Harvey, looks ok
Harvey passed us lthis am, ran behind sea anchor all night, not much sleep
Harvey gone  pastt, ran behind sea anchor 2nd night, now going again to E
In Horta, most probs fixed, leaving about 23rd w Willie Irene + Roy
Dep Horta 1615Z on 23/8 w Willie, Irene + Roy. Autopilot ok.Nxt stop Plymouth
Two days out of Horta, avg 115mpd in direction of Lizard (Plymouth)
3 days out of Horta, avg 119 mpd in direction of Lizard (Plymouth), 823m to go
540 miles to Plymouth, flat calm, motoring, head winds fcst
380 miles to Plymouth, light head winds, motorsailing
300 miles to Plymouth, good wind, making 6 kts motorsailing
160 miles to Plymouth, gd wind, making 6 kts motorsailing, blue skies
